result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas William Stark

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER and is represented. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas William Stark appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Lucas William Stark.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings. Remand is lifted.

11/10/22 Return on Doctor's Report rescheduled to fit within the timeline. Next court date is 10/27/22 at 9:00 am. Parties have been notified via e-mail and instructed to contact court for more information/ objection.

Case in court for doctor's report return.  Both parties do not contest doctor's report.  Court ordered commitment for treatment evaluation.  Case adjourned for doctor's report return.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Prior to commencement of the hearing repeated outbursts and utterings by defendant.
Due to the disruptive nature Court orders defendant removed from the courtroom; competency hearing to proceed without defendant present in court.

Hearing commences:
Sworn and testified for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins
Court took judicial notice of the doctor's report.
Arguments by the State and defense counsel.

Based upon the defendant's behavior in court and the testimony of Dr. Collins, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. 

Court finds at this time he cannot order involuntary administration of medication.  The facility should petition the court.

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.  Defendant to be transported FORTHWITH.

Clerk:  jms
Competency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Case called with defendant appearing via Zoom video; during the hearing due to technical difficulties with the sound, Court requests that defendant be brought to court.
Back on the record; defendant now present in court.
During the hearing, repeated interruptions and outbursts by defendant.
Court attempts to review the doctor's report with the parties.
Court halts the hearing and orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics confirmed Dr. Collins' availability as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated March 29, 2022 - received
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lucas William Stark appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  

Hearing will be held on Dacast:

Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
